newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Infratil's portfolio worth NZ$243.5 mln.
newsitem.headline: Infratil's portfolio worth NZ$243.5 mln.

text.p: Infrastructure and Utilities Ltd (Infratil) said on Tuesday its portfolio had a market value by March 31 of about NZ$243.5 million against $141.9 million a year earlier.
The figure includes cash and is adjusted for tax on holdings in Infratil Securities.
Infratil earlier reported a net profit after tax but before investment realisations of NZ$5.70 million in the year to March from $3.25 million a year earlier.
Including investment realisations, net profit after tax was NZ$6.32 million against NZ$4.34 million.
Based on market prices as at May 5, net tangible asset backing was 128.7cps, up from 121.9 cents at March 31.
In the six months to March, the company had finalised a merger between CentralPower and ElectroPower, the Palmerston North-based electricity distributor.
As a result of the merger the Palmerston North City Council became a 30.4 percent shareholder in Centralpower and Infratil's shareholding in the combined entity was diluted to 16.6 percent.
But Infratil had since increased its shareholding in CentralPower to 19.8 percent, the company said.
